Interface Wrapper

All Known Implementing Classes:
ByteArrayWrapper, IdentityWrapper
public interface Wrapper
A Wrapper is used to decorate objects. A Wrapper, contrary to the Encoder, does not cause data conversion and it's used to provide additional behaviour to the encoded data such as equality/hashCode and indexing capabilities.
Since:
9.1

    • isFilterable

      boolean isFilterable()
      Returns:
      true if the wrapped format is suitable to be indexed or filtered, thus avoiding extra unwrapping.
